intro: Machaeranthera aspera, commonly known as roughleaf bluetailed flower, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue-violet flowers. Its flowering period typically occurs in late spring to early summer. The species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
